question is should radio and television be combined and
operated under one management thus using some of the same
equipment and personnel in both broadcasting media?
Until OSU officials feel they have the answers to
these and other questions, they will find it difficult to
make adequate decisions on the kind of building needed,
amount and kind of equipment to order, and qualifications
of television personnel. One means of helping these OSU
officials to acquire some of the necessary information
would be for the NAEB to make available to them descriptions
of existing television operations such as at Iowa State
College and Michigan State College.
Job Evaluation
Regardless of whether or not Ohio State University
obtains a television station, it can continue to improve its
radio station. One way for improvement is for the station
staff to make an evaluation of the work which each member
does. This self-evaluation could be more effectively
accomplished if staff members had job descriptions of other
university radio stations. Would it be possible for NAEB to
devise a self-evaluation form which radio workers could use
in describing their jobs and rating them? Secondly, could
NAEB circulate these descriptions among the interested stations?
